newsitem.title: USA: Lycos new search engine finds video.
newsitem.headline: Lycos new search engine finds video.

text.p: Lycos Inc unveiled a new kind of search engine Tuesday that brings pictures, video, audio and multimedia images, as well as text to those surfing the Internet.
"This does for the Web what CD-ROMs did to software. It puts the fun factor back into it," said Lycos chief executive officer Bob Davis in a telephone interview.

Lycos, which offers its search engine for free on the Web, generates a large part of its revenues from advertising on its site and Davis expects the new searching capabilities to bring even more viewers to Lycos' home page.

"On any given day we have something in excess of four million paid views...and I fully expect an increase in traffic with this multimedia service." Davis said, noting that so far Lycos has 160 companies advertising on its site.
The Lycos product differs from both the offerings of MSNBC, the cable television-computer product from Microsoft and General Electric owned NBC television, Davis said.
"MSNBC will give you its own stuff... I'm going to give you a pictorial archive of everything that has ever been posted on the Web," he said, adding "and then I'll give you any audio."
Lycos can be found on the Web at http://www.lycos.com.
